case.sLatestTextSummary: Per Jai's comment this has been resolved in the latest build
case.sTitle: Target page-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter

event.s:
From: "J, Prakash" <JP@advisory.com> Date: Fri, 9 Nov 2012 10:20:51 -0500 To: "Crimson Market Advantage Cases" <CMA-cases@advisory.com> Cc: Subject: Target page-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash
DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Target page-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
STEPS TO REPRODUCE :
1. Opportunities-> Target page ->Targets-> set the page filter by keeping any specialties (filter) involved in it(Keep other filters as it is) and apply it
2. Then rest the filter
3. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the specialties filter text box still points the “All Selected”
Note: The above same has been happened if we have few other filter setting in the “Apply filter” option. They are, Employment status, Sub service lines. The same has been observed for the individual physicians-> Network tab
ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:
Actual Result: Specialties filter fails to show the specialty set in the apply filter
Expected results: Specialties filter show have to reflect the specialty set in the apply filter
IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium
BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:
Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>
DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango
Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango
Server: 192.168.17.82
BROWSER: IE8
event.sSubject: Target page-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter

REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash
DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Target page-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
STEPS TO REPRODUCE :
1. Opportunities-> Target page ->Targets-> set the page filter by keeping any specialties (filter) involved in it(Keep other filters as it is) and apply it
2. Then rest the filter
3. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the specialties filter text box still points the “All Selected”
Note: The above same has been happened if we have few other filter setting in the “Apply filter” option. They are, Employment status, Sub service lines. The same has been observed for the individual physicians-> Network tab
ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:
Actual Result: Specialties filter fails to show the specialty set in the apply filter
Expected results: Specialties filter show have to reflect the specialty set in the apply filter

DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango
Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango
Server: 192.168.17.82

event.sBodyHTML:
REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash

 

DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE:  Target page-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter 

 

STEPS TO REPRODUCE :

 

1.       Opportunities-> Target page ->Targets-> set the page filter by keeping any specialties (filter) involved in it(Keep other filters as it is) and apply it

2.       Then rest the filter

3.       Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the specialties filter text box still points the  “All Selected”

 

Note: The above same has been happened if we have few other filter setting in the “Apply filter” option. They are,  Employment status, Sub service lines. The same has been observed for the individual physicians-> Network tab

 

 

ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:

 

Actual Result: Specialties filter fails to show the specialty set in the apply filter

 

Expected results: Specialties filter show have to reflect the specialty set in the apply filter

 

IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE:  Medium

 

BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:

 

Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>

DB:   Lakelandhealth_Tango

Release:  CMA.2012.09.Tango

Server: 192.168.17.82

BROWSER:  IE8

event.s:
From: "FogBugz" <cma-cases@advisory.com> Date: Tue, 13 Nov 2012 08:55:25 -06:00 To: "J, Prakash" <JP@advisory.com> Cc: Subject: Re: (Case 54948) Target page-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter Jai, I chose filter settings, applied them and saved that filter. Then reset the filters and then reloaded the saved filter. Everything came up as it should. If I am misunderstanding, please send me instructions on how to recreate this. I am closing the others as well 'As responded' as please let me know if I need to try something else to reproduce this - debra
-- FogBugz cma-cases@advisory.com --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Powered by FogBugz from Fog Creek Software. http://www.fogcreek.com/fogbugz

>REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash > >DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Target page-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter > >STEPS TO REPRODUCE : > >1. Opportunities-> Target page ->Targets-> set the page filter by keeping any specialties (filter) involved in it(Keep other filters as it is) and apply it > >2. Then rest the filter > >3. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the specialties filter text box still points the “All Selected” > >Note: The above same has been happened if we have few other filter setting in the “Apply filter” option. They are, Employment status, Sub service lines. The same has been observed for the individual physicians-> Network tab > >ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS: > >Actual Result: Specialties filter fails to show the specialty set in the apply filter > >Expected results: Specialties filter show have to reflect the specialty set in the apply filter > >IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium > >BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB: > >Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4> > >DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango > >Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango > >Server: 192.168.17.82 > >BROWSER: IE8
event.sBodyHTML:
Jai,
I chose filter settings, applied them and saved that filter.  Then reset the filters and then reloaded the saved filter.  Everything came up as it should.  If I am misunderstanding, please send me instructions on how to recreate this.  I am closing the others as well 'As responded' as please let me know if I need to try something else to reproduce this - debra

--
FogBugz
cma-cases@advisory.com

case.sTitle: Geographic analysis-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter

event.s:
From: "J, Prakash" <JP@advisory.com> Date: Fri, 9 Nov 2012 11:35:34 -0500 To: "Crimson Market Advantage Cases" <CMA-cases@advisory.com> Cc: Subject: Geographic analysis-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash
DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Geographic analysis-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
STEPS TO REPRODUCE :
1. Opportunities-> Geographic analysis-> choose any area from the map and then perform actions-> competitor facilities
2. Then choose any service lines and apply it, then save the filter settings through “Apply filter”
3. Then reset it
4. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the service lines filter text box still points the “All Selected”
ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:
Actual Result: Service lines filter fails to show the service lines set in the apply filter
Expected results: Service lines should have to reflect the service lines set in the apply filter
IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium
BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:
Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>
DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango
Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango
Server: 192.168.17.82
BROWSER: IE8
event.sSubject: Geographic analysis-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
event.sBodyText:
REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash
DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Geographic analysis-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
STEPS TO REPRODUCE :
1. Opportunities-> Geographic analysis-> choose any area from the map and then perform actions-> competitor facilities
2. Then choose any service lines and apply it, then save the filter settings through “Apply filter”
3. Then reset it
4. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the service lines filter text box still points the “All Selected”
ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:
Actual Result: Service lines filter fails to show the service lines set in the apply filter
Expected results: Service lines should have to reflect the service lines set in the apply filter
IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium
BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:
Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>

event.sBodyHTML:
REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash

 

DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE:  Geographic analysis-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter 

 

STEPS TO REPRODUCE :

 

1.       Opportunities-> Geographic analysis->  choose any area from the map and then perform actions-> competitor facilities

2.       Then choose any service lines and apply it, then save the filter settings through “Apply filter”

3.       Then reset it

4.       Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the service lines filter text box still points the  “All Selected”

 

 

 

 

ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:

 

Actual Result: Service lines filter fails to show the service lines set in the apply filter

 

Expected results: Service lines should have to reflect the service lines set in the apply filter

 

IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE:  Medium

 

BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:

 

Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>

Then choose any service lines and apply it, then save the filter settings through “Apply filter” > >3. Then reset it > >4. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the service lines filter text box still points the “All Selected” > >ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS: > >Actual Result: Service lines filter fails to show the service lines set in the apply filter > >Expected results: Service lines should have to reflect the service lines set in the apply filter > >IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium > >BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB: > >Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4> > >DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango > >Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango > >Server: 192.168.17.82 > >BROWSER: IE8
event.sSubject: Re: (Case 54955) Geographic analysis-> Filter values seen doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
event.sBodyText:
Jai, I chose filter settings, applied them and saved that filter. Then reset the filters and then reloaded the saved filter. Everything came up as it should. If I am misunderstanding, please send me instructions on how to recreate this. I am closing the others as well 'As responded' as please let me know if I need to try something else to reproduce this - debra
-- FogBugz cma-cases@advisory.com --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Powered by FogBugz from Fog Creek Software. http://www.fogcreek.com/fogbugz

Then choose any service lines and apply it, then save the filter settings through “Apply filter” > >3. Then reset it > >4. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the applied filter, but the service lines filter text box still points the “All Selected” > >ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS: > >Actual Result: Service lines filter fails to show the service lines set in the apply filter > >Expected results: Service lines should have to reflect the service lines set in the apply filter > >IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium > >BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB: > >Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4> > >DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango > >Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango > >Server: 192.168.17.82 > >BROWSER: IE8
event.sBodyHTML:
Jai,
I chose filter settings, applied them and saved that filter.  Then reset the filters and then reloaded the saved filter.  Everything came up as it should.  If I am misunderstanding, please send me instructions on how to recreate this.  I am closing the others as well 'As responded' as please let me know if I need to try something else to reproduce this - debra

case.sTitle: Market leakage-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter

event.s:
From: "J, Prakash" <JP@advisory.com> Date: Fri, 9 Nov 2012 10:03:09 -0500 To: "Crimson Market Advantage Cases" <CMA-cases@advisory.com> Cc: Subject: Market leakage-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash
DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Market leakage-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
STEPS TO REPRODUCE :
1. Opportunities-> Market leakage ->Physicians-> set the page filter by keeping the metric as contribution margin (Keep other filters as it is) and apply it
2. Then reset the filter
3. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the contribution margin but the metric text box still points the “Revenue”
Note: The above same has been happened if we have few other filter setting in the “Apply filter” option. They are, Specialties, Employment status, Sub service lines
ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:
Actual Result: Metric symbol not changing to contribution margin
Expected results: Metric symbol should be points the revenue
IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium
BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:
Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>
DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango
Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango
Server: 192.168.17.82
BROWSER: IE8
event.sSubject: Market leakage-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
event.sBodyText:
REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash
DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Market leakage-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
STEPS TO REPRODUCE :
1. Opportunities-> Market leakage ->Physicians-> set the page filter by keeping the metric as contribution margin (Keep other filters as it is) and apply it
2. Then reset the filter
3. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the contribution margin but the metric text box still points the “Revenue”
Note: The above same has been happened if we have few other filter setting in the “Apply filter” option. They are, Specialties, Employment status, Sub service lines
ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:
Actual Result: Metric symbol not changing to contribution margin
Expected results: Metric symbol should be points the revenue

Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>
DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango
Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango
Server: 192.168.17.82
BROWSER: IE8
event.sBodyHTML:
REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash

 

DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE:  Market leakage-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter 

 

STEPS TO REPRODUCE :

 

1.       Opportunities-> Market leakage ->Physicians-> set the page filter by keeping the metric as contribution margin (Keep other filters as it is) and apply it

2.       Then reset the filter

3.       Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the contribution margin but the metric text box still points the “Revenue”

 

Note: The above same has been happened if we have few other filter setting in the “Apply filter” option. They are, Specialties, Employment status, Sub service lines

 

ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:

 

Actual Result: Metric symbol  not changing to contribution margin

 

Expected results: Metric symbol should be points the revenue

 

IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE:  Medium

 

BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:

 

Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>

DB:   Lakelandhealth_Tango

Release:  CMA.2012.09.Tango

Server: 192.168.17.82

BROWSER:  IE8

event.s:
From: "J, Prakash" <JP@advisory.com> Date: Fri, 9 Nov 2012 09:50:08 -0500 To: "Crimson Market Advantage Cases" <CMA-cases@advisory.com> Cc: Subject: Performance change-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter REPORTED BY: Jai Prakash
DESCRIPTION OF ISSUE: Performance change-> Metric filter value setting doesn’t correspond to the applied filter
STEPS TO REPRODUCE :
1. Opportunities-> Performance change->Physicians-> set the page filter by keeping the metric as volume (Keep other filters as it is) and apply it
2. Then rest the filter
3. Now apply the saved filter, the result seen is corresponding to the volume but the metric text box still points the “Revenue”
NOTE: So that, the volume result seen with the “$”(dollar) symbol. Please refer the screen shot
ACTUAL RESULTS VERSUS EXPECTED RESULTS:
Actual Result: Metric symbol doesn’t change to volume
Expected results: Metric symbol should be points the volume
IMPACT OF ISSUE TO DEPLOYMENT OF THE RELEASE: Medium
BUILD VERSION/SITE URL/DB:
Site: https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4 <https://cmastg.crimsonservices.com/Lakelandhealth_Tango/Profiles/Facilities/Utilization/4>
DB: Lakelandhealth_Tango
Release: CMA.2012.09.Tango
Server: 192.168.17.82
BROWSER: IE8

case.sTitle: Market Leakage > Service Lines tab: Needs Optimization

event.s:
Market Leakage > Service Lines tab
The query that populates this tab needs to be optimized. It often takes a really long time to load, and frequently times out. An example site is:
https://cma.crimsonservices.com/MountainStatesMarketAdvantage/Login.aspx login: urbachs pw: butt.it
Thanks,
Scott

case.sLatestTextSummary: [Mass Edit] We will be tracking these issues via their development tickets and not through these tickets. I am closing all of them as a result.

event.s: Load Error Messages in the temp tables are not reset prior to running loaders. For example temp_salesrecords should have it's loaderrormessages reset in LoadSalesrecords prior to actually updating Salesrecords. This would ensure that records tied to physicians who just showed up in the roster are retroactively loaded.
event.sHtml: Load Error Messages in the temp tables are not reset prior to running loaders.  For example temp_salesrecords should have it's loaderrormessages reset in LoadSalesrecords prior to actually updating Salesrecords.  This would ensure that records tied to physicians who just showed up in the roster are retroactively loaded.

case.sLatestTextSummary: [Mass Edit] We will be tracking these issues via their development tickets and not through these tickets. I am closing all of them as a result.

event.sHtml:
The LoadZips loader for CMA reads from a static file.  There seems to be a constraint that does not allow multiple loads to read from this file simultaneously.  I received the error message below on a recent load on the LoadZips loader. I re-ran the loader without any problems after receiving this error and making no changes.  As you can see, the error states that the static file is being used by another process.

CMA often runs many loads simultaneously.  I have heard of others running into similar errors.  We need to ensure that multiple loads can run simultaneously without any issues.


The Member Loader Command "LoadZips" threw an exception: "System.IO.IOException: The process cannot access the file 'C:\Citadel\Loader\Market Advantage\2012.01\SSISPackages\RawData\temp_ZipBoundaries.csv' because it is being used by another process.    at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)    at System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath)    at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy)    at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options)    at Crimson.CMA.Loader.Commands.LoadZips.UnzipCSVFile(FileInfo fi)    at Crimson.CMA.Loader.Commands.LoadZips.Execute()    at Crimson.CMA.Loader.Commands.MemberLoaderCommand.RunLoad()" ;

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Nick Allen by Reagan Dooley (SVCS)

event.sHtml: [Mass Edit] We will be tracking these issues via their development tickets and not through these tickets.  I am closing all of them as a result.

event.s: Reconciler loader has a key in the loadersettings table called "ReconcilerTargetDB". I verified in the reconciler loader code that this key operates in an intuitive way. The loader pulls tables from the db the loader is running on and pushes them to the target DB. In reality the loader would be run on the DB that is being reconciled (the target DB), so the key and loader should operate by defining the source DB. The loader should then pull tables from the source DB to the DB the loader is running on.
event.sHtml: Reconciler loader has a key in the loadersettings table called "ReconcilerTargetDB".  I verified in the reconciler loader code that this key operates in an intuitive way.  The loader pulls tables from the db the loader is running on and pushes them to the target DB.  In reality the loader would be run on the DB that is being reconciled (the target DB), so the key and loader should operate by defining the source DB.  The loader should then pull tables from the source DB to the DB the loader is running on.

Targets page - by first name (this needs to be changed to sort by last name).
Thanks, Alykhan
